data.title: Tony Blair
data.text:
[1] Although born in Scotland and attended high school there, Blair is the son of an English father and Irish mother. For his entire political life he has represented English constituencies, not Scottish.

Father: Leo Charles Blair (barrister, b. 4-Aug-1923, d. 16-Nov-2012)

Mother: Hazel Elizabeth Rosaleen Corscaden (b. 12-Jun-1923, d. 28-Jun-1975)

Brother: William James Lynton Blair (judge, b. 31-Mar-1950)

Wife: Cherie Blair (barrister, m. 29-Mar-1980, three sons, one daughter)

Son: Euan Anthony Blair (b. 19-Jan-1984)

Son: Nicholas John Blair ("Nicky, b. 6-Dec-1985)

Daughter: Kathryn Hazel Blair (b. 2-Mar-1988)

Son: Leo George Blair (b. 20-May-2000)

High School: Fettes College, Edinburgh, Scotland

University: Oxford University

UK Prime Minister (2-May-1997 to 26-Jun-2007)

UK Official Shadow Home Secretary (1992-94)

UK Official Shadow Secretary of State for Employment (1989-92)

UK Official Shadow Secretary of State for Energy (1988-89)

UK Member of Parliament for Sedgefield (1983-)

Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament

Fabian Society

Labour Party (UK) (1975-, as Leader, 1994-2007)

World Economic Forum Foundation Board

World Technology Network

Dubya Nickname Landslide

Dubya Ranch Hand Apr-2002

Audience with the Pope Feb-2003

Funeral: Diana, Princess of Wales (1997)

Funeral: Ronald Reagan (2004)

Converted to Catholicism 21-Dec-2007 (from Anglicanism)

Presidential Medal of Freedom 13-Jan-2009

Dan David Prize 2009

Funeral: Margaret Thatcher (2013)

Funeral: Ariel Sharon (2014)

English Ancestry Paternal

Irish Ancestry Maternal

Risk Factors: Smoking

FILMOGRAPHY AS ACTOR

The Class of '92 (29-Nov-2013) · Himself

Countdown to Zero (25-Jan-2010) · Himself

Rotten Library Page:

Tony Blair

Appears on the cover of:

The Economist, 4-Oct-2003, DETAILS: Wielders of mass deception? (with George W. Bush)
